content.description: I have tried this route only once, but it did not go great. It seems to me like the bolts are a bit far right. However, with some traffic and beta for the start, this route could clean up nicely. Start to the right in some bushes and climb small crimps through a small roof, angling left (watch for choss). Pull fun ledges and slopers to a mantle (or go left to a jug), then walk up slab to the anchor.
content.protection: 2 bolts to make a TR. Bring slings for the anchor.
content.location: The higher set of bolts on the Hangover boulder.

content.description: My favorite warm up at Natural Bridge! Set up your top rope, then start on a sidepull to the left of a small tree and climb through stellar ledges and slopers. Stay to the right of the rope for the bottom half, then transition up and left on small holds 2/3 of the way up (crux). Find a hidden jug of a sidepull and shoot to the top. Thoughtful climbing on great holds.
content.protection: 2 bolts to make a TR. Bring slings for the anchor.
content.location: Access the boulder from either the east or west by some easy scrambling. It can be difficult to find the bolts the first time. This route climbs the lower set of bolts.
